In a Dirty Tavern

Dimly lit room, Svidrigaïlov grinning, Raskolnikov confused.  
“Strange how I found you here.”  
“Why not call it a miracle?”  
“It may just be chance.”  

---  

Svidrigaïlov leans back, glass in hand, amused.  
“Cowards hide their opinions, Rodion.”  
“Not me. I have my own.”  
“That's why you caught my curiosity.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov unexpectedly encounters Svidrigaïlov at a dismal tavern, leading to a discussion about chance and belief in miracles.
